CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Procedural aspect);Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security;Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the city of ORG in GPE .
CARDINAL . At the material time the applicant and her family lived in PERSON , in a private household comprising QUANTITY houses at CARDINAL FAC .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s son PERSON , born in DATE , his wife , PERSON , the applicant ’s son - in - law , PERSON , born in DATE , her daughter PERSON and their neighbour ORG ( also spelled GPE ) , who had come to visit them , were at home . The applicant was away and therefore her account of the events of that date was based on eyewitness statements of her family members .

CARDINAL . At TIME a group of CARDINAL federal servicemen arrived at the applicant ’s household in CARDINAL armoured personnel carriers ( APCs ) . The identification number of CARDINAL of the vehicles was CARDINAL , whilst the other carriers had no such numbers on them . The servicemen in camouflage uniforms were armed with AK-CARDINAL machine guns , ORG carabines and pistols . They had masks on , except for CARDINAL officers in command . Those CARDINAL officers had portable radio transmitters . All the servicemen spoke NORP without any accent . CARDINAL of them entered the courtyard of the applicant ’s household whilst QUANTITY others stayed near the APCs .

CARDINAL . The servicemen broke down the door of CARDINAL of the houses , in which there were the applicant ’s son , her son - in - law and ORG , and searched the house , without presenting any documents to authorise their actions . According to the applicant , during the search the soldiers asked if the CARDINAL men had drugs , arms or GPE dollars . They also allegedly demanded gold and money .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s daughter and PERSON wife , who were in the other house at that moment , heard the noise , ran out to the courtyard and saw CARDINAL or CARDINAL servicemen there and several other soldiers inside the house with their relatives . The servicemen prevented the women from entering that house . They were hostile and aggressive . Some time later the servicemen left the house and forced PERSON , PERSON and ORG outside . They ordered the CARDINAL men to stand against the wall and checked their passports .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , the servicemen spent TIME in her courtyard and then left , having taken her son , her son - in - law and ORG away . They told the applicant ’s daughter that they would check the CARDINAL men ’s identities and release them . The servicemen then put the applicant ’s relatives and ORG into the APCs and drove off in the direction of the centre of ORG . The applicant submitted that the only road to the centre of PERSON had been blocked by a federal military check - point , but the APCs openly passed through it .

CARDINAL . The applicant further relied on ORG statements to the effect that the CARDINAL men had been taken to LOC of the Interior of PERSON ( Старопромысловский временный отдел внутренних дел г. Грозного – “ the LOC ” ) and interrogated . The interrogators did not introduce themselves or disclose what public bodies they represented . The CARDINAL men were allegedly told that there was a report stating that they had been detained at the Staropromyslovskiy military check - point for insulting federal servicemen .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s CARDINAL relatives and ORG spent TIME in a cell , along with another person . On DATE at TIME PERSON and PERSON were taken away from LOC in a ORG all - terrain vehicle . ORG was released TIME and returned home . PERSON and PERSON remain missing to date .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , on CARDINAL DATE “ unidentified persons armed with firearms apprehended PERSON , PERSON and ORG in a private household and delivered them to PERSON . The DATE ORG was released , whilst PERSON and PERSON were taken away by unidentified persons in an unknown direction ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE , immediately after the detention of PERSON and PERSON , the applicant ’s daughter - in - law informed the applicant of the incident . Thereafter the applicant ’s daughter - in - law went to her brother - in - law , PERSON , who was an officer of ORG of ORG ( ORG по Чеченской Республике – “ ORG of the ORG ” ) . The latter attempted to pursue the APCs in his personal car , but did not find them . He learnt from servicemen at the check - point near the applicant ’s house that the APCs had passed there at CARDINAL a.m. DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went to the prosecutor ’s office of GPE ( прокуратура Чеченской PERSON DATE “ ORG of the Chechen Republic ” ) and informed them about the detention of her relatives .

CARDINAL . Thereafter she visited the Staropromyslovskiy VOVD . An officer whose name was PERSON told her that her CARDINAL relatives had been taken away in an ORG all - terrain vehicle by CARDINAL military officers of LOC , PERSON He also allegedly told the applicant that those CARDINAL officers must have delivered her son and son - in - law to either the main federal military base at GPE or the town of ORG and promised her that he would find out their whereabouts .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and other members of her family went to PERSON , where they were told by a serviceman named PERSON that the CARDINAL men had been released .

CARDINAL . Since CARDINAL DATE the applicant and other members of her family have been searching for PERSON and PERSON . On numerous occasions , both in person and in writing , they have applied to prosecutors at various levels , to ORG , to the administrative authorities in GPE . In letters addressed to the authorities the applicant stated the facts of her relatives’ detention and asked for assistance and details of the investigation . The applicant received hardly any substantive information from official bodies about the investigation into the disappearance of her son and son - in - law . On several occasions she received copies of letters by which her requests had been forwarded to various prosecutors .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant also visited the federal military base at GPE and saw a register of persons detained there . She claimed that the names of her son and son - in - law were not on that list .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE administration in ORG issued a certificate to confirm that PERSON had stayed there DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the Government , on DATE ORG ( прокуратура г. Грозного ) instituted criminal proceedings in connection with the disappearance of PERSON and PERSON under LAW of LAW ( kidnapping of CARDINAL or more persons by a group using firearms ) . The applicant insisted that the criminal proceedings had been instituted on DATE , as indicated in the decision of an investigator of the prosecutor ’s office of LOC of PERSON dated DATE . The case file was given the number DATE .

CARDINAL . During the investigation the authorities identified CARDINAL military servicemen who had taken part in the apprehension of the applicant ’s relatives . They were GPE , both from PERSON and on mission in GPE . Those CARDINAL servicemen were called for questioning to ORG on DATE . The applicant submitted copies of summonses . She alleged that in the case file she had seen a transcript of interviews with GPE in which they had admitted that they had illegally arrested PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , but the investigator in charge had not allowed her to study that document or to make a copy of it . The Government submitted that the information on the existence of an interview transcript where T. and PERSON admitted the unlawful arrest of PERSON was not true . The Government emphasised that PERSON had not denied that they had brought the applicant ’s son to LOC ; however , they had had no information about their whereabouts after that . The investigator had had valid grounds to deny the applicant permission to make copies of the transcript .
CARDINAL . At some point in DATE the case file was transferred to the military prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . DATE ( военная прокуратура DATE ) located in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the latter replied to the applicant ’s husband and to ORG that they had no criminal case file concerning the abduction of his son and son - in - law .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG of the ORG informed ORG that on DATE their CARDINAL officers , PERSON had detained PERSON , PERSON and ORG for a breach of public order in the vicinity of the “ Neftyanik ” market in ORG and had taken those CARDINAL individuals to LOC , having reported the detention in writing to the head of the said PERSON . The letter also stated that the aforementioned officers had no information as to the subsequent fate of the detainees .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s husband wrote to ORG of GPE and enquired about his relatives’ whereabouts and details of the investigation . He also asked whether they had ever been charged with any crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s daughter wrote to the Prosecutor General seeking assistance in ensuring that an effective investigation be carried out by local prosecutors .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s husband applied to the military prosecutor of GPE with a request to inform him about progress in the investigation . He re - stated the circumstances of the detention of PERSON and PERSON and referred to the information about the CARDINAL servicemen , PERSON insisting that they should be questioned in connection with the disappearance of his relatives .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , on behalf of the applicant , requested ORG to provide information on the investigation in the criminal case opened in connection with the abduction of PERSON and PERSON .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the military prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . CARDINAL replied that they did not have a file for criminal case no . DATE or any information about the detained men or servicemen PERSON

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s husband submitted an application to a department of ORG of the ORG responsible for searching for missing persons . He gave details of the detention of PERSON and PERSON , as well as their personal details , a description of the clothes they had been wearing on DATE of detention and the known steps of the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s daughter applied to the head of ORG asking for help to find her relatives .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE informed the applicant that it had studied the criminal case file opened in connection with her CARDINAL relatives’ abduction and then forwarded it to ORG for further investigation , instructing the latter to take “ more active steps ” to locate the missing men . The letter contained no further information .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG replied to the applicant that following her complaint ORG of the ORG had been instructed to take all possible measures to establish the whereabouts of PERSON and PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicant ’s husband submitted complaints to ORG of GPE . On DATE he also submitted a similar complaint to the military prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE informed the applicant ’s husband that they had studied the file of the investigation into the abduction of his relatives , and ordered the investigators in charge to take steps to establish the whereabouts of the victims and of the culprits . The letter assured that the investigation of the crime was supervised by ORG of GPE .

CARDINAL . By letter of DATE ORG of GPE informed the applicant that they had studied the file of the criminal case opened in connection with the abduction of her relatives and then forwarded it to ORG for an additional investigation . The letter assured the applicant that ORG had been instructed to carry out a number of investigative measures and that she would be notified of the results of the investigation .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG of GPE forwarded the applicant ’s query regarding the investigation to ORG and invited it to determine the question of the responsibility of servicemen PERSON , who had participated in the detention of the applicant ’s CARDINAL relatives .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE again transferred the file of case no . DATE , which they had studied following the applicant ’s request , to ORG . ORG of GPE stated that its earlier instruction had not been complied with and invited ORG to extend the time - limit for a preliminary investigation and to carry out a thorough investigation , as well as to conduct an internal inquiry in connection with the ORG failure to comply with the instructions of the superior prosecutor ’s office .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , at some point she had found out that in DATE the investigator in charge had gone to PERSON and interrogated PERSON , who had allegedly confirmed that they had arrested PERSON and PERSON .
CARDINAL . At some point in DATE criminal case no . DATE had been transferred to LOC ( прокуратура Заводского района г. Грозного ) .

CARDINAL . By decision of DATE an investigator of ORG ordered that the criminal proceedings in case no . DATE instituted on DATE in connection with the abduction of PERSON and PERSON be discontinued . The decision stated in particular :

“ The preliminary investigation has established that on DATE at TIME officers of the ORG in camouflage uniforms armed with firearms entered unlawfully and without authorisation a household at CARDINAL FAC ... in PERSON belonging to the ORG , and after a search had delivered PERSON , PERSON and PERSON to PERSON of PERSON . Thereafter [ the officers ] left without drawing up reports on the detention of the aforementioned persons . DATE PERSON was released whilst PERSON and PERSON , whose whereabouts have not been established to date , were taken away from the territory of LOC of PERSON by ORG officers [ T. ] and [ M. ] to an unknown destination . ”

CARDINAL . The decision further referred to statements from a number of witnesses , including the applicant ’s daughter and daughter - in - law , the applicant ’s CARDINAL neighbours and ORG , all of whom had given a similar description of the events of CARDINAL DATE . The decision also stated that ORG officer ORG had been questioned on DATE and DATE and ORG officer PERSON had been questioned on DATE and DATE . They both testified that on CARDINAL DATE in the vicinity of the “ NORP ” market in PERSON they had apprehended CARDINAL men , including PERSON and PERSON , for insulting local residents with swearwords , had taken them to LOC and had left the detainees there . The next day they had found out that the detainees had been released . Officer PERSON stated that he had drawn up a report on the detention of the CARDINAL men , whilst officer PERSON submitted that he did not remember whether he had drawn up any reports . The decision further stated that the fact of the apprehension on DATE of the applicant ’s relatives and ORG had been confirmed by the head of LOC in a letter of DATE and by the acting head of ORG of the ORG in a letter of CARDINAL DATE . The decision continued that on DATE an investigator of ORG had examined the register of persons held in LOC and had found out that the names of the applicant ’s son , son - in - law and ORG had not been listed among those detained there . The decision also referred to the statement of PERSON , who between CARDINAL April and DATE had been seconded to GPE as the head of the police of LOC . PERSON had stated that on a date which he could not remember ORG officers had delivered CARDINAL persons , who , as claimed by those officers , had been detained during a “ sweeping - up ” operation in LOC on suspicion of their involvement in illegal military activity . Officers PERSON had asked PERSON to keep the detainees until TIME and then release them except for PERSON and PERSON , as those CARDINAL were to be taken away by ORG personnel . According to B. , on DATE he had released the detainees , whilst GPE and PERSON had been taken away by ORG and M. The decision further relied on a letter of CARDINAL DATE from the head of ORG of the ORG , the permanent place of service of officers PERSON , who had confirmed that on CARDINAL DATE the said CARDINAL officers had , indeed , delivered the applicant ’s relatives to PERSON , but had no information as to the subsequent fate of PERSON and PERSON , as on TIME CARDINAL DATE those CARDINAL individuals had been taken away by personnel of another division of ORG of the ORG . The decision continued as follows :

“ During the preliminary investigation only a fact of the breach by the head of LOC of the procedural requirements relating to placement in detention and transfer of detainees was reliably established ; however , the said actions did not constitute a criminal offence under LAW and were punishable in disciplinary proceedings . The fact of the abduction of PERSON and PERSON by officials of the PERSON was not confirmed during the preliminary investigation . ”
CARDINAL . The decision thus concluded that there was no evidence of a criminal offence under LAW in the actions of officials of LOC of PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the criminal proceedings in case no . DATE were resumed and , according to the Government ’s submissions , on DATE the case file was forwarded to the military prosecutor ’s office of ORG ( военная прокуратура NORP группировки войск ) for a further investigation , so as to check the possible involvement of the military personnel in the alleged offence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was suspended for failure to identify those responsible , and then resumed on DATE .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the applicant had been questioned by the investigators on DATE and DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE respectively and had been granted the status of victim on DATE . The applicant ’s husband had been questioned and declared a victim on DATE . The applicant ’s daughter and daughter - in - law had been questioned on DATE and DATE respectively and granted the status of victim on DATE . The investigating authorities had also questioned PERSON , CARDINAL neighbours of the applicant and CARDINAL officials of the ORG and ORG who at the material time had been working in PERSON . The Government did not specify on what date witness statements had been obtained and submitted that the witnesses concerned had testified that they had no information regarding the perpetrators of the offence in question . According to the Government , it was impossible to establish other witnesses in the case but the search for them was currently underway . Lastly , the ORG stated that the investigating authorities had sent a number of queries to various ORG bodies on DATE , CARDINAL , DATE and DATE , CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE , CARDINAL May and DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE and had undertaken other investigative measures , but did not specify what those measures had been .

CARDINAL . The Government further submitted that during the questioning on DATE the applicant had stated that on DATE following the apprehension of her son and son - in - law she had learnt from an acquaintance , PERSON , that her son had been abducted because of a debt owed to PERSON . by his brother . They had then gone to see PERSON and discussed the payment of the debt . During questioning on an unspecified date , PERSON . had confirmed that the applicant ’s son owed him money in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) but denied any involvement in his abduction . The statement was confirmed by a witness , PERSON The investigating authorities could not question PERSON because he had died in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator sent requests for information on the possible detention of PERSON and PERSON to penitentiary facilities of the PERSON and surrounding regions . Furthermore , he sent requests to departments of the interior and the ORG located in CARDINAL administrative units of GPE concerning their possible detention and institution of criminal proceedings against them . No relevant information was received .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the investigation was suspended on account of the failure to identify the culprits . The applicant was informed accordingly .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the investigating authorities that Mr Musitov had left GPE . Therefore he could not be questioned .

CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the investigator sent instructions to district prosecutors of GPE to take certain investigative measures in respect of former officials of PERSON , which were later complied with .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator questioned PERSON , who stated that the register of the temporary detention centre contained no relevant information . It is not clear who PERSON was , but he apparently referred to the temporary detention centre of LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator instructed the prosecutor of LOC of GPE to question Mr Ts . During the questioning PERSON . stated that Mr PERSON , PERSON brother , had not repaid the debt but he had nothing to do with his brother ’s abduction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was again suspended on account of the failure to identify the culprits .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE respectively the applicant ’s relatives Mr Kh . and PERSON were questioned . They made no relevant statements .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was suspended on account of the failure to identify the culprits . The applicant was informed accordingly .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE a request was sent to the Commander of the NORP military District . He replied that he had no information on the detention of any persons in the relevant period .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant was questioned again . She stated that she believed Mr Ts . had been involved in the abduction .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date former officials of ORG were questioned . They stated that they had no information on law - enforcement officials’ involvement in an abduction of PERSON allegedly instigated by PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was suspended on account of the failure to identify the culprits . The applicant was informed accordingly .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator sent requests concerning the whereabouts of PERSON and PERSON to military commander ’s offices , the ORG units , departments of the interior , town and district prosecutor ’s offices of GPE and other competent authorities . No relevant information was received .
DATE . On DATE the investigation was resumed . The investigator reiterated the requests sent on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was suspended on account of the failure to identify the culprits .
CARDINAL . On DATE the investigation was resumed .
CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON , PERSON brother , was questioned . He stated that he had not been at home when his brother had been apprehended and had heard from others about what had happened .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON was granted victim status in the proceedings and reiterated his previous statement . The Government submitted that from his statement and the applicant ’s statement made on DATE it appeared that PERSON could be detained in penitentiary facilities of FAC . The investigator sent relevant requests to the penitentiary facilities . However , according to the information received , he had not been held there .
CARDINAL . It appears that the investigation was suspended once again and then resumed on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint against the investigators with ORG of Grozny ( “ the FAC ” ) . She claimed that the investigating authorities had not taken all possible and necessary measures and had thus failed to carry out an effective investigation into the disappearance of her son and son - in - law . She also complained that the question of the responsibility of servicemen PERSON had not been investigated and that all her requests regarding the results of the investigation had remained unanswered or had only produced standard replies . In her court complaint the applicant referred to LAW and LAW . She requested that the court find unlawful the inactivity of the investigating authorities and order ORG to carry out an effective investigation .

CARDINAL . By decision of DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint , having stated that “ the investigating authorities had undertaken all necessary measures ” and that the applicant “ had not pointed out what particular measures could otherwise be taken ” .

DATE . On DATE ORG of GPE dismissed the applicant ’s appeal and upheld the first - instance decision on appeal . It noted in particular that the involvement of federal servicemen in the detention and subsequent disappearance of PERSON and PERSON had been established and therefore the investigation of the case fell within the competence of military prosecutors . In this connection , on DATE the Zavodskoy ORG had transmitted the case file to ORG of GPE for its further transfer to the military prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . DATE .

CARDINAL . Despite specific requests made by ORG on QUANTITY occasions , the Government did not submit a copy of any of the documents to which they referred . Relying on the information obtained from ORG , the ORG stated that the investigation was in progress and that disclosure of the documents would be in violation of LAW , since the file contained information of a military nature and personal data concerning the witnesses or other participants in the criminal proceedings . At the same time , the Government suggested that a ORG delegation could have access to the file at the place where the preliminary investigation was being conducted , with the exception of “ the documents [ disclosing military information and personal data of the witnesses ] , and without the right to make copies of the case file or to transmit it to others ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG declared the application admissible and reiterated its request for a copy of investigation file no . DATE . ORG also requested information on the progress of the investigation after DATE .

CARDINAL . In response , the ORG submitted an update on the investigation but no documents from the investigation file except for decisions to suspend and resume the investigation and the decision to grant victim status to PERSON . They reiterated that disclosure of the documents would violate LAW since the file contained information concerning military operations as well as personal data of participants in the criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . Until DATE criminal - law matters were governed by LAW RSFSR . On DATE the old Code was replaced by LAW ( the new ORG ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the new ORG provides for judicial review of decisions by investigators and prosecutors that might infringe the constitutional rights of participants in proceedings or prevent access to a court .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the new ORG stipulates that evidence from the preliminary investigation may not be disclosed . Part CARDINAL of the same LAW provides that information from the investigation file may be divulged with the permission of a prosecutor or investigator , but only in so far as it does not infringe the rights and lawful interests of the participants in the criminal proceedings and does not prejudice the investigation . It is prohibited to divulge information about the private life of participants in criminal proceedings without their permission .
